title: PGP (Pretty Good Privacy)
overview: Phil Zimmermann releases PGP, bringing strong cryptography to the public for email and file encryption, sparking global policy debates.

title: SSL 2.0 Introduced
overview: Netscape introduces SSL 2.0, the first widely used web encryption protocol, enabling secure e-commerce and HTTPS.

title: TLS 1.0 Standardized
overview: The IETF standardizes TLS 1.0, replacing SSL and establishing the basis for modern secure Internet communications.

title: Mafiaboy DDoS Attacks
overview: A teenager known as Mafiaboy launches DDoS attacks on Yahoo, CNN, eBay, and Amazon, raising global awareness of Internet vulnerabilities.

title: USA PATRIOT Act
overview: In response to 9/11, the US enacts the PATRIOT Act, expanding surveillance powers and sparking ongoing debates about security vs. privacy.

title: Snowden Revelations
overview: Edward Snowden leaks NSA documents revealing global surveillance programs, triggering worldwide debates on digital privacy and security policies.

title: Heartbleed Vulnerability
overview: A critical bug in OpenSSL exposes millions of websites to data leaks, highlighting the risks of widely used open-source infrastructure.

title: Mirai Botnet DDoS
overview: The Mirai botnet hijacks IoT devices to launch massive DDoS attacks, temporarily crippling DNS provider Dyn and major online services.

title: Equifax Data Breach
overview: Hackers exploit a web vulnerability to steal sensitive data from Equifax, affecting over 145 million individuals in one of the largest breaches ever.

title: GDPR Enforced
overview: The EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) comes into effect, setting global benchmarks for privacy rights and corporate compliance.

title: Colonial Pipeline Ransomware Attack
overview: A ransomware attack shuts down Colonial Pipeline, disrupting fuel supplies across the US East Coast and highlighting cyber-physical risks.

title: Log4Shell Vulnerability
overview: A remote code execution flaw in Apache Log4j library exposes millions of systems to attack, called one of the most critical software vulnerabilities ever.
